Well, I'm not old, emoticon_xgood but I'm still here....just reading and running though. I'll put in a vote for SLP, by far and away the funniest debater on this or any other fora.

No offense but i dont think he is....... your more serious when it comes to debates.

 
 You should have seen him on www.creationtalk.com
 
 That was my introduction to the 'evolution' of debates. He and other evolutionaries changed the rules so fast it was a sight to behold
 
 They'd quote from Dawkins. I'd quote from Richard Milton. They'd say, 'you can't quote from him, he's a creationist'
 I said 'if that's the case, you can't quote from Dawkins, he's an evolutionist'
 
 I'd quote someone
 They'd say 'what are his credentials?'
 THEN
 I'd quote from someone and list his/her credentials
 They'd say, 'you're just listing these credentials to make him/her sound more impressive!'
 
 They'd ask me to provide references for my arguments.
 Yet one person replied to my four points with 'False', 'False', 'False', & 'False',!
 
 Then, although SLP can't take credit for this one, someone said that the onus of, or burden of proof/disproof was on the creationist, regardless of who made the statement! If I made a statment, I'd have to prove it. If they made a statment, they didn't need to prove it, and I had to disprove it!
 
 Now that's funny!
 emoticon_smile
